Reason: The 'flush_compression' configuration option in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because changing its value can significantly impact system performance. When compression is enabled during the flushing process, it can affect the execution time and memory consumption of the system. Disabling compression may lead to faster flushes but higher memory usage, while enabling compression may reduce memory usage but increase execution time. Therefore, the value of 'flush_compression' can have a notable effect on system performance, making it performance-sensitive.
